subject: Critical Thinking
title: Clickbait and Engagement Traps
description: A short lesson to help you apply Clickbait and Engagement Traps.

hook.text: 'You won't BELIEVE what happened next.' You will believe it. It's mundane. But you clicked. Mission accomplished.

buildup.text: Clickbait exploits the curiosity gap: a headline that reveals just enough to make you need to know more.

discovery.text: It works because incomplete information creates cognitive tension. Your brain needs closure â€” and clicking provides it.

twist.text: The content rarely delivers on the headline's promise. But the click already generated ad revenue.

climax.text: Defense: if a headline makes you desperate to click, notice that feeling. It's designed.

punchline.text: If the headline sounds too shocking, the article will be too boring.

quiz.question: What psychological mechanism does clickbait exploit?
options: The curiosity gap â€” incomplete information creates a need for closure
